entry.title: In rare speech, Serzh Sargsyan rebukes Pashinyan and calls for change

media:group.media:title: In rare speech, Serzh Sargsyan rebukes Pashinyan and calls for change
media:group.media:description:
üìç Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan has proposed that Armenia and Azerbaijan sign a peace treaty and simultaneously request the formal dissolution of the OSCE Minsk Group. üìç Hungary has blocked an EU defense aid package for Armenia for six weeks, highlighting tensions within the bloc and Budapest‚Äôs continued alignment with Russia and Azerbaijan. üìç In a rare public address, former President Serzh Sargsyan sharply criticized Armenia‚Äôs leadership over the loss of Artsakh and outlined his party‚Äôs vision for restoring national strength and unity. üìçArmenia reports progress in talks over airport expansion: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RVlVJvyu1AU

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs ice hockey team victorious in second consecutive game

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs ice hockey team victorious in second consecutive game
media:group.media:description:
Armenia‚Äôs national ice hockey team clinches a 3-2 shootout victory in a neck-and-neck game against Uzbekistan on April 14, the second day of the International Ice Hockey Federation World Championship, Division IV.
The tightly-contested match saw two goals scored from each team in the second period, with no goals in the first and third periods. After a goalless overtime, the teams went straight into a thrilling shootout, with Armenia winning by a score of two goals to one.
Prior to the match, Armenia‚Äôs head coach Vadim Guskov said that on paper Uzbekistan‚Äôs team is a cut above the rest, making this victory particularly significant for Armenia.

entry.title: Mirzoyan rejects linking Turkey normalization to Azerbaijan process

media:group.media:title: Mirzoyan rejects linking Turkey normalization to Azerbaijan process
media:group.media:description:
üìç At the Antalya Diplomacy Forum, Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan emphasized cautious optimism in efforts to normalize ties with Turkey and finalize a treaty with Azerbaijan. üìç Armenian rights groups have asked the government to delegate consular protection of the detainees in Baku to Switzerland, following Azerbaijan‚Äôs suspension of the International Committee of the Red Cross from fulfilling the role. üìç Will lower oil prices fuel aggression from Baku?- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=669tuejcfcI

entry.title: Armenia reports progress in talks over airport expansion: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia reports progress in talks over airport expansion: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç A senior Armenian infrastructure official reported progress in negotiations with the foreign conglomerate that owns Yerevan‚Äôs main airport over a major expansion plan. üìç Plans by Armenia and the Emirates‚Äô state-owned renewable energy company to open a major solar power plant are back on track, Armenia‚Äôs Economy Ministry announced. üìç The Eurasian Economic Union plans to launch an integrated electricity market at the beginning of 2027, a senior Russian official confirmed to the Izvestia newspaper.

entry.title: New aid program launched for displaced Karabakh families

media:group.media:title: New aid program launched for displaced Karabakh families
media:group.media:description:
üìç Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev met with his Turkish counterpart Recep Erdoƒüan today in Antalya to discuss bilateral ties and the situation in the South Caucasus. Aliyev also received a Nowruz congratulation letter from President Donald Trump that mentioned normalization with Armenia. üìç A new financial assistance program for vulnerable families forcibly displaced from Nagorno-Karabakh was approved by the Armenian government. üìç An international conference organized by the Azerbaijani Foreign Ministry was held in Rome yesterday. The event is part of Azerbaijan‚Äôs ongoing campaign to reframe Armenian religious and cultural heritage in the South Caucasus as Azerbaijani, effectively erasing the region‚Äôs Armenian presence.
